misuse.notes: According to a source who contacted the Free Press, the man allegedly accessed the personal health information of several members of his own family, including his brother who has since died of cancer, his brother's wife, and his own children.  The source said all of the health information was looked at "without the consent or knowledge of the victims, and was taken as a massive breach of trust and invasion of privacy."

internal.notes: looked at records of family members

asset.notes: Following enumerations present before veris 1.3.3 removed: asset.governance.Unknown.

confidentiality.notes: The information that could be accessed included what prescription drugs had been received, social insurance numbers, demographic information including birth date, personal health information numbers, and Pharmacare deductible information.

discovery_notes: The Free Press first reported on the allegations in November 2014, when Manitoba Health alleged the former employee had accessed the personal health information of at least 13 people while working there. It is not known why only one charge was laid.
summary: Charge laid against Manitoba Health employee accused of inappropriately accessing health information
